result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan J Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 14CF36 & 14CF38 called together at 9:11 am 
[Reserve Judge Daniel Klossner presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Johnathan J Wagner in court, in custody, with Attorney Joanne M. Keane. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF38: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Wagner waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 14CF36

Court sentences Mr. Wagner to 3.5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 71 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessments, per Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least one time per month)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program 
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No contact with Kimberly Rostollan or Arturo Castro
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To reimburse buy money of $180, ($100 joint & several with Kimberly Rostollan (14CF34) - $80 14CF38
--To pay $50 drug testing fee ($25 is joint & several with Kimberly Rostollan-(14CF34)

No suspension of driving privileges
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

from Attorney Joanne M Keane informing the Court that the parties have reached a full agreement in the case and they hope they might be able to conclude them at tomorrow's Court appearance (received by fax with cover sheet)
Scheduling order
Jury trial on April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF36 & 14CF38 called together at 2:07 pm 
[Reserve Judge Daniel Klossner presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Johnathan J Wagner appears via video, in custody, with Attorney Joanne M. Keane. ADA Theresa Ann Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Keane: Have been in contact with the State regarding settlement of case; do believe case will still settle, but not quite there. Request matter be set for trial or another matter short of trial. 
ADA Beck: would request matters be set for FSSC & JT
Counsel agree each case will need 1 day for trial
Court orders all motions to be filed by 4/4/14
Court reminds Mr. Wagner that his bonds/conditions of release remain in effect while cases are pending
Recess: 2:13 pm Reconvene: 2:14 pm 
Appearances the same
Court reviews with Atty Keane that Clerk informed him that a preliminary hearing has not yet been conducted in either case
Atty Keane confirms and indicates that it is the Defense position to waive preliminary hearing
Recess: 2:15 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule Waiver of Preliminary Hearing 3/28/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule FSSC 4/8/14 at 1:30 pm (3) Schedule JT 4/14/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on March 14, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Atty. Keane informs the Court that settlement discussions are ongoing between the State and the Defense. 
Scheduling issues addressed by the Court and Counsel.

case recalled at 2:09 pm
Attorney Svehlek appears for the defendant via video from the Jefferson County Jail. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews that it received conflict review worksheets for the defendant. Court finds that there is no conflict.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that she did go over with Mr. Wagner that a conflict check would have been completed by the Court

recess: 2:11 pm
to cover 14CF36 & 14CF38

Cases 14CF36 & 14CF38 called at 1:47 pm
Defendant Johnathan J Wagner in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

off record: Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant is eligible for SPD representation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Upon questionning of the Court, the defendant informs the Court that his first name is spelled Johnathan.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaints are correct.

14CF38:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

14CF36: 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.
DA Happ informs the Court that the Defendant is on a PO hold.

Court requires $1,500.00 CASH bond to cover both cases, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 
-No contact with Kimbery Rostollan 

Recess: 1:58 pm
